channel.title: Compiler issue?
channel.description: When I try to compile the delta source client it would say in the compiler, "The system cannot find the file specified." What does this mean and what do I do?

item.title: Compiler issue?
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

in other words, u havent set ur environmental variables

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue?
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

It means your compiler is trying to compile with a java version you don’t have (invalid/non-existant path). You can either set the classpaths, or:

  • Go to: C:/ > Program Files > Java (or wherever you installed Java)
  • Find the name of any folder inside ‘Java’ that starts with ‘jdk’
  • Copy the name of that folder.

Right-click your compiler and paste the following into it:

@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\foldernameyoucopiedhere\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

If you can’t find any ‘jdk’ folders or even the ‘Java’ folder, you haven’t installed JDK. In this case, go to the Java website and download and install it.

Read full topic
